description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1ku0","text":"Concentrated, intact, and biologically-active DNA templates are essential for protein production using cell-free expression. We present automated methods for DNA template preparation and quantitation towards improving reproducibility in cell-free expression.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"236js","text":"Certain commercial entities, equipment, or materials may be identified in this document in order to describe an experimental procedure or concept adequately. Such identification is not intended to imply recommendation or endorsement by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, nor is it intended to imply that the entities, materials, or equipment are necessarily the best available for the purpose.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
document: {"blocks":[{"key":"10ep7","text":"The following automated methods for DNA template preparation and quantitation were developed for improving reproducibility in cell-free expression and are described in detail elsewhere.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qs7u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"68f8r","text":"These methods were developed using the Hamilton STAR automated liquid handler with the Monitored Multi-Flow Positive Pressure Evaporative Extraction ([MPE]2) module. For questions about methods or implementation, contact Jane Romantseva (eugenia.romantseva@nist.gov).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":155,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bir4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ci9","text":"Disclaimer: Certain commercial entities, equipment, or materials may be identified in this document in order to describe an experimental procedure or concept adequately. keywords: cell-free expression, automated DNA extraction, automated DNA purification, DNA template preparation,automated DNA quantitation
manuscript_citation: Romantseva E.F., Tack D.S., Alperovich N., Ross D., Strychalski E.A. (2022) Best Practices for DNA Template Preparation Toward Improved Reproducibility in Cell-Free Protein Production. In: Karim A.S., Jewett M.C. (eds) Cell-Free Gene Expression. Methods in Molecular Biology, vol 2433. Humana, New York, NY. https://doi.org/10.1007 /978-1-0716-1998-8_1

references.title: Best Practices for DNA Template Preparation Toward Improved Reproducibility in Cell-Free Protein Production.
references.authors: Romantseva EF, Tack DS, Alperovich N, Ross D, Strychalski EA

status.info:
These methods were developed using the Hamilton STAR automated liquid handler with the Monitored Multi-Flow Positive Pressure Evaporative Extraction ([MPE]2) module. 

As each automation system can be unique, these methods may need to be further optimized based on, for example, the type of liquid handler and labware available.

For questions about methods or implementation, contact Jane Romantseva (eugenia.romantseva@nist.gov).

title: Automated DNA template preparation and quantitation methods
title_html: Automated DNA template preparation and quantitation methods
